translated: The Story of the Elder Dhūpadāyaka🔽“I gave a house incense

analyzed: loka jeṭṭhassa tādinaḥ  kuṭi dhūpam mayā dinna
translated: the chief in the world, the one who is content;

analyzed: yam yam yonupapajjāmi  devattam atha mānusa
translated: Wherever I was reborn,🔽whether as a god or a human;
this is the fruit of giving incense.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving incense.
The six super knowledges have been experienced,
the instruction of the Buddha has been done.”🔽Thus the venerable Dhūpadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā dhūpadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Dhūpadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā dhūpadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽dhūpadāyaka therassa apadānam chaṭṭha
translated: The Story of the Elder Dhūpadāyaka is the sixth.
